casebody.data:
James N. Donvan, respondent, v. William B. Welsh appellant. Decided March 4, 1884. Appeal by defendant from judgment entered upon verdict of jury in favor of plaintiff, and from order denying motion for new trial made upon the judge’s minutes. William H. Gibson, for appellant; Payson Merrill, for respondent.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., Truax and O’Gorman, JJ.

Per Curiam.

Judgment affirmed, with costs. Order appealed from affirmed, with $10 costs and disbursements to be taxed.
